title: Pair arrested after police find ‘semi-conscious woman’ raped in central London
text:
Police closed off Sicilian Avenue after a woman was reportedly attacked (Picture: BPM Media)

Two men have been arrested after a semi-conscious woman was found in the street by police officers after she had just been raped.

The woman was discovered on Holborn’s Sicilian Avenue in the early hours of Saturday morning.

Police cordons blocked entry to the pedestrian shopping parade as forensics officers searched for evidence.

Scotland Yard said in a statement: ‘On Saturday October 19 at around 3.40am police on patrol in Sicilian Avenue came across a semi-conscious female.

‘The woman they believe had been raped.

‘Two men were arrested at the scene and are currently in custody at central London police stations.

‘Enquiries are ongoing.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: Police found her in London's famous Sicilian Avenue in the early hours of Saturday morning.
